fee_structure.time_of_payment: Within seven days of declaration of the Selection Process Result

eligibility: •    Candidates who have completed Bachelors’ degree in any discipline •    Who have minimum 50% of marks from a recognized University •    Preference will be given to working professionals especially those in educational, occupational and health settings, NGOs and other service centric professionals. •    Passion for counselling service and adaptability to multicultural practice •    Who have basic understanding about counselling
why_choose: Why choose this course? Professional guidance and support High emphasis on practice Application of skills in diverse settings Internship Qualified pool of faculty with 85% of them possessing PhD Industry Tie-ups for placements, projects, and internships.
what_learn: What you will learn? Approaches and techniques in individual and group counselling Assessments in counselling practice Professional and ethical practices in diverse settings
modules: Modules Approaches and techniques in Individual Counselling Counselling across the lifespan Mental Health Disorders Multicultural Counselling Skills Assessments in Counselling Year 1 Approaches and techniques in Group Counselling Counselling in diverse settings (health, educational and occupational settings) Cross-cultural advanced counselling skills Assessments in applied contexts Field work and Practicum
